snippet: Supporters said the move would remove the marijuana trade from the domain of illegal traffickers, allowing the authorities to regulate its consumption.
abstract: Uruguay's Senate approves legislation that will allow the country to legalize the cultivation and sale of marijuana on a nationwide scale.

byline.contributor: Fabián Werner contributed reporting from Montevideo, Uruguay.

lead_paragraph: Supporters said the move would remove the marijuana trade from the domain of illegal traffickers, allowing the authorities to regulate its consumption.

keywords.value: Institute for the Regulation and Control of Cannabis (Uruguay)
keywords.name: organizations
